titles.title: Antiprogestin Testing Act of 1993
To provide for research on antiprogestin drugs through the National Institutes of Health.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

committee.name: House Committee on Energy and Commerce

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Health and the Environment.

bill.summary: 1/5/1993--Introduced. Antiprogestin Testing Act of 1993 - Directs the Secretary of Health and Human Services to conduct and support research, including clinical trials, on antiprogestin drug safety and efficacy for any potential use, including termination of pregnancy, contraception, and therapeutic use for cancer, endocrine disorders, and endometriosis. Makes the research subject to provisions of the Public Health Service Act relating to institutional review boards and peer review.
